Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that windmills can generate more energy than was invested in building them.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the idea that windmills will never create as much energy as was invested in building them.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it selectively quotes a partial text and omits critical information and context.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the energy invested in building a windmill cannot be outweighed by the energy it generates.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that windmills can have an energy payback day in three years or less in a good wind site.
